figure_1:
Case 1, Primary myelofibrosis: Myelofibrosis and fibroblast-stimulating cytokines identified by immunohistochemistry in bone marrow tissue in Case 1
Notes: A, B: HE staining showing bone marrow fibrosis (MF); C, D: Silver staining: MF grade 2-3; E, F: Positive staining for TGF- beta1 in macrophages and megakaryocytes; G, H: Positive staining for TNF-alpha 1 in macrophages and megakaryocytes; I, J: Positive staining for VGEF in macrophages and megakaryocytes; K, L: Positive staining for basic FGF in macrophages and megakaryocytes; M, N: Positive staining for PDGF in macrophages; O, P: Positive staining for IL-2 in macrophages and megakaryocytes.
figure_2:
Case 10, AML: Myelofibrosis and fibroblast-stimulating cytokines identified by immunohistochemistry in bone marrow tissue
A, B: HE staining showing bone marrow fibrosis (MF); C, D: Positive staining for silver MF grade 2-3; E, F: Positive immunostaining for TGF-beta1 in macrophages and megakaryocytes; G, H: Positive staining for TNF-alpha1 in macrophages and megakaryocytes.
figure_3:
Case 45, DLBCL: Fibrosis and fibroblast-stimulating cytokines identified by immunohistochemistry in bone marrow tissue
A, B: HE staining showing bone marrow fibrosis (MF); C, D: Positive staining for silver; E, F: Positive staining of the DLBCL cells for TGF-beta1; G, H: Negative staining for TNF-alpha1.
figure_4:
Case 28, DLBCL: Fibrosis and fibroblast-stimulating cytokines identified by immunohistochemistry in bone marrow tissue
A, B: HE staining showing bone marrow fibrosis (MF); C, D: Positive staining for silver; E, F: Negative staining of the DLBCL cells for TGF-beta1; G, H: Positive staining for TNF-alpha1.
